page.title: 14THE STORY OF CULBIN
page.content: Culbin was a very rich and fertile estate, so productive it was called the Granary of Moray.In the 1660's great Sandunes built up off Culbin.Steadely the sand was blown over Culbin until almost all the Estate was covered, to a great depth at some points, by sand and sand hills.Farms, cottages, walls, fields and the Manor House were all covered. The sand deserts covered an area 6 miles long by 2 miles wide at places.Culbin sands was known as a silent eerie place constantly changing with each storm.Reclamation started in the mid 1800's with tree planting round the edges.In 1922 the Forestry Commission started planting Culbin.To protect the young trees cut branches were placed butt end towards the prevailing wind in the sand.Now there is a large forest.
